title: Removed Redundant Version Command
details:
Successfully removed redundant version functionality from Notebook Automation CLI:

PROBLEM:
- CLI had both --version global option AND version subcommand
- This created confusing duplicate functionality
- Standard CLI convention is to use --version option only

SOLUTION:
1. Deleted src/c-sharp/NotebookAutomation.Cli/Commands/VersionCommands.cs
2. Deleted src/c-sharp/NotebookAutomation.Cli.Tests/Commands/VersionCommandsTests.cs  
3. Removed VersionCommands registration from Program.cs
4. Updated configuration display logic to remove version command checks
5. Kept ShowVersionInfo() method in Program.cs for --version option

RESULTS:
- Clean CLI interface with single version option: --version
- Professional version output maintained
- No build errors or test failures
- Standard CLI convention followed
- Help output no longer shows redundant version command
- When user tries 'na version', gets helpful suggestion to use '--version'

FINAL CLI BEHAVIOR:
✅ na --version → Shows professional version info
❌ na version → Error with helpful suggestion to use --version
✅ Clean help output without duplicate version entry

This eliminates user confusion and follows standard CLI practices.
